text:
Hi everyone. I'm Jennifer 
from English with Jennifer.

Do you know what happens every four years 
in January? Inauguration Day. In the U.S.,

Inauguration Day is when the President officially 
takes office. Inauguration is what we call the

ceremony. It's when someone officially begins a 
new job or position, in this case the presidency.

Let me quiz you. Let's see how much 
you know about Inauguration Day.

I have 10 questions for you. One. 
When exactly is Inauguration Day?
January 20th

Two. Where is the Inauguration? In Washington, 
D.C., the capital of the United States.
Note how I spell "capital" with an "a" here.

The actual ceremony takes place in 
front of the U.S. Capitol (with an

"o"). The Capitol Building is where Congress 
meets. Congress is the legislative branch.

Three. Here's a language question. If 
"inauguration" is the noun, what's the verb?
Inaugurate. Listen how the stress shifts.

Inauguration. Inaugurate. 
Inauguration. Inaugurate.
Do you know a phrasal verb for this process?
